title: BBC Local Live: Beds, Herts & Bucks on Monday 10 August 2015 - BBC News
summary: a bedford councillor accused of punching two teenagers in sharnbrook says he 's relieved he 's finally been acquitted .
a family who 've been farming on land in buckinghamshire for 120 years are facing eviction if 1,800 new homes are approved .
a man being cared for at keech hos in luton says he 'll spend the rest of his life raising money for the charity .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on tuesday .

documents.title: goodnight from us
text: that 's all from the team across beds , herts and bucks for today , but we 'll be back with you from 08:00 tomorrow .
here 's a quick summary of our top stories today :

documents.title: stowe bridge in buckinghamshire
text: the main image at the top of our live page today shows stowe bridge in buckinghamshire , which crosses the oxford water in the national trust landscape gardens of stowe .
thank you to buckinghamshire county council for sharing this serene photograph with us .
if you 'd like to share your images to feature on the bbc website , please get in contact via
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: canal restored after boater drains grand union
text: a stretch of the grand union canal in buckinghamshire 's cook wharf was drained after a boater
author: Get Bucks

documents.title: titchmarsh 's garden for keech hos
text: keech hos care in luton will be revealing a new , custom-designed garden next week which has been created by celebrity gardener alan titchmarsh .
mr titchmarsh and his team from the television programme , love your garden , chose keech as the special organisation out of 100 they visited to build a wildlife garden for .
he said .
`` it 's clearly made a tremendous difference to the surroundings . ''
the garden will be officially opened next week as part of
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: hertfordshire man sentenced before for indecent images
text: a man from hertfordshire has been sentenced to two years in jail at st albans crown court after police found more than 900 indecent images of children on his computer in a raid in january .
graham livermore , 65 , of rugby way , croxley green , had been given a three year community order in 2010 for downloading and possessing indecent images .

last july , following a police investigation which found over 1,600 images , livermore received a 12 month suspended sentence for two years after a judge was told that the offender suffered from multiple sclerosis .
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: mk dons debuts tomorrow
text: mk dons ' new signings sergio aguza , cristian benavente and matt upson will make their debuts tomorrow night against leyton orient in the capital one cup .
manager karl robinson will make a host of changes to his team following the 4-1 win at rotherham in the championship .
author: Geoff Doyle
BBC Three Counties Radio sport

documents.title: weather : becoming dry and fine
text: tonight : there will be a few scattered showers this evening .
it will then become dry with mainly clear skies and light winds .
lows of 11c ( 52f ) .
tomorrow : a fine and dry day with good spells of sunshine , especially in the morning .
feeling a little fresher tomorrow , but still pleasantly warm with highs of 22c ( 71f ) .
author: Alina Jenkins
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: hs2 : affected residents speak out
text: i 've been at the bucks goat centre this afternoon , one of the stops on the latest hs2 select committee visit to the chilterns , speaking to people affected by the proposed high speed rail link .
`` my house is going to have no value at all , and it 's actually going to be uninhabitable .
i 'm outside the 16 metre zone so they 're not willing to buy the house '' , one resident said .
he added that he is expecting hs2 to cost him `` conservatively £ 150,000 to move for nothing . ''
author: Paul Scoins
Political reporter, BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: the news so far this afternoon
text: the top stories across the three counties :
author: Jon Kaye
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: busy roads this afternoon
text: the roads are beginning to look quite busy across beds , herts and bucks this afternoon .
you can
public transport seems to be running well .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: hertfordshire man sentenced for indecent images
text: a hertfordshire man who suffers with multiple sclerosis has been told by a judge that his medical condition can not be used as a `` get out of jail card '' after being caught with child sex abuse images for the third time .

graham livermore , 65 , of rugby way , croxley green , was sentenced to two years at st albans crown court - 12 months for breaching a suspended sentence passed last year , and another 12 months for current offences .
david chrimes , prosecuting , said police found more than 900 indecent images in livermore 's home in a raid in january .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: england rugby legends grayson , back and vickery battle it out in hitchin
text: england rugby legends battled it out in the kitchen of a hitchin restaurant
author: Hertfordshire Mercury

documents.title: mk farmer facing eviction says farm 'part of family history '
text: a family who 've been farming on land in buckinghamshire for 120 years are facing eviction in just three months if 1,800 new homes are approved .
farmer andrew gurney said the family will lose a `` considerable amount '' in income .
`` it 's obviously very important for business reasons but it 's important also because of the history . ''
five generations of the gurney family have been tenants at easton leys farm near bletchley ( original lease where they grow crops and keep livestock .
mr gurney also said the farm is the `` ancient site of a magiovinium roman fort settlement which they are n't allowed to build on '' .
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: keech patient 's fundraising mission
text: a man being cared for at keech hos in luton says he 'll spend whatever time he has left raising money for the charity to employ another nurse .
`` you need to come round to understanding that the services provided by keech are life sustaining '' , said tony jules from sundon park who has terminal cancer .
`` it is not a place where people come and receive short shrift treatment - you are a human being , you are treated with dignity and you are not a number . ''
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: hs2 : select committee visit steeple claydon residents
text: the mps on the hs2 select committee have been in the buckinghamshire village of steeple claydon .
they met residents , councillors and land owners from the village , which will see seven to eight years of construction when hs2 goes ahead .
they 'll shortly be at the bucks goat centre before finishing off in princes risborough .
author: Paul Scoins
Political reporter, BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: if you 're just catching up
text: the top stories we 're looking at :
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: tractor fire in bucks
text: firefighters in buckinghamshire had to move a tractor off the road in saunderton yesterday after it 's trailer of hay caught fire .
once the tractor was moved off road , firefighters from buckinghamshire and milton keynes fire and rescue service controlled the burning in a neighbouring field .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: man paralysed in screwdriver attack to take part in triathlon
text: a man whose right-hand side was paralysed when he was
nick verron , 31 , who now lives in aylesbury , suffered an unprovoked attack in bournemouth in 2009 and was `` unable to walk , talk or swallow '' .
he is taking part in the para tri at dorney lake , windsor .
author: BBC News
UK

documents.title: cars destroyed by blaze in bedfordshire
text: numerous vehicles were destroyed by a fire at a car sales garage in bedfordshire at the weekend .
bedfordshire fire and rescue were called to j & n motors leighton road in stanbridge just before 23:30 on saturday after police reported smoke in the area .
six cars were alight when firefighters arrived , two of which were completely destroyed .

`` from our preliminary investigation it appears that several cars were daubed with paint before their windows were broken and the upholstery in at least one car set fire to , '' station commander steve allen said .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: doug mcmurdo wins 'hot fuzz ' assault appeal
text: a bedford borough councillor has

during the original sentencing hearing , prosecutor tristan driscoll described the incident on 22 february last year , as something from `` simon pegg 's hot fuzz comedy film '' , where the older community try to murder young newcomers threatening their way of life .
an earlier hearing was told that when the teenager pushed him away , he punched him in the eye .
mr mcmurdo , a borough councillor since 2009 , said he acted in self-defence and told the court : `` i felt very intimidated . ''
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: avian botulism may have killed st albans ducks
text: the lake at verulamium park is closed to pets after sus that recent
author: St Albans & Harpenden Review

documents.title: summit to discuss milk prices
text: farming unions are warning of a crisis as they hold a summit to discuss milk prices .
dairy farmers say supermarkets are paying so little for their milk that it 's forcing them out of business .
gary spears , who runs two farms in bedfordshire and hertfordshire , said : `` most people quite happily pay more for their milk if they 're asked to .
i think this whole cycle of downward pressure on prices could be alleviated quite considerably if supermarkets could bring themselves to charge a little bit more than 89p for four pints of milk . ''
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: bedford councillor acquitted of punching teenagers
text: a bedford councillor accused of punching two teenagers in sharnbrook says he 's relieved he 's finally been acquitted .

milton keynes magistrates ' court heard that cllr mcmurdo and a friend had been involved in a confrontation with two boys , aged 16 and 17 , as they walked home after watching a rugby match at sharnbrook social club .
the court ruled that the inconsistencies in the two teenagers evidence meant mr mcmurdo had `` no case to answer '' .
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: weather : rain expected
text: we may see some rain for a time this lunchtime , before it brightens up towards the evening .
although still a warm day , it will end up feeling fresher compared to sunday .
maximum temperature : 22c ( 72f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: travel : delays on roads and rails
text: there is
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: shahana uddin murder : two deny murder
text: two people who appeared at st albans crown court today have denied charges of murdering a
salma begum , 32 , and suhail uddin , 35 , both of leavesden road , denied killing shahana uddin , 19 , who died from injuries after being physically assaulted .

laila begum , 25 , of grove road , romford ; tohel uddin , 24 , and jhuahal uddin , 33 , both of middle ope , watford ; and jewel uddin , 27 , and rehena uddin , 22 , both of leavesden road , watford , pleaded not guilty to causing or allowing the death of a vulnerable adult and a charge of conspiracy to pervert the course of justice .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: shahana uddin murder : seven appear before judge
text: seven people have appeared before a high court judge today over the murder of a teenager in watford last year .
shahana uddin ( 19 , died from injuries at her home in leavesden road on 11 october .
she had been physically assaulted , a post mortem revealed .
the trial , expected to last eight weeks , will start at st albans crown court on 12 october .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: mk farmer eviction : pressure for new homes 'acute '
text: the pressure for new homes in the three counties has been described as `` acute '' by a hertfordshire-based property agent as a tenant farmer faces eviction due to plans to build 1,800 new homes .
henry pryor said : `` we have a shortfall nationally across the uk of roughly 100,000 homes per annum over the last decade . ''
andrew gurney , whose family has been farming the land for over a century , has been told he 'll have just three months to leave the farm at eaton leys near bletchley if the plans are approved .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: hs2 : another visit to the chilterns
text: another day , another visit from mps to buckinghamshire to view the proposed hs2 route through the chilterns .
even though the select committee has dismissed the idea of a long tunnel , three new mps in the group will today get a chance to view some of the places in a whistle-stop tour .
twenty-five locations will be visited , i 'll try and get myself - and these bags of equipment - to as many as i can .
author: Paul Scoins
Political reporter, BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: if you 're just joining us
text: the top stories this lunchtime :
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: cctv released after man stabbed in dunstable robbery
text: cctv has been released of two men who stabbed a night porter during a robbery at a hotel in dunstable .
the two men demanded a night porter open a safe at the old palace lodge hotel in church street on 6 july at about 01:10 so that they could take cash .
one of the men stabbed the night porter as they left , police believe .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: luton travel centre will 'improve access ' to station
text: the new luton travel centre `` perfectly complements '' work `` to improve access for pedestrians and cyclists between the station area and the town centre '' .
that is the view of portfolio holder for regeneration at luton borough council , councillor sian timoney on the £ 600,000 building opposite the town 's main railway station .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: £ 600k luton travel centre opens
text: a new travel centre costing more than half a million pounds opens in luton today opposite the town 's main railway station .

the building , which houses a ticket desk , travel planning area and travel information facilities , will be open daily from 07:00-18:00 after a grant from the government 's local sustainable transport fund of £ 600,000 .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: milton keynes family farmers face eviction after 120 years
text: a farmer from buckinghamshire says he 's been left in limbo as he awaits a decision on whether 1,800 new homes will be built on his land .
the gurney family have been tenants at eaton leys farm near bletchley for 120 years - their home for five generations .

`` when we 're farming , we look forward many years to what we 're going to grow in which field , i ca n't really do that now '' , said andrew gurney , who will have just three months to remove his crops and livestock if the homes get the go ahead .
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: hannah burke wins ladies ' european tour event
text: a sensational display from welwyn garden city golfer hannah burke saw her triumph at the tipsport golf masters in the czech republic to
author: Welwyn Hatfield Times

documents.title: beds police 's child sexual exploitation awareness campaign
text: bedfordshire police 's summer-long campaign to raise awareness of child sexual exploitation is underway as the force says many cases are going undetected .
a senior officer
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: ambulance service interim chief steps down
text: the interim chief executive of the east of england ambulance service ( eeas ) , who had been criticised over his pay ,
dr anthony marsh will remain chief executive of the west midlands ambulance service after previously combining both roles .
the eeas nhs trust said it was in the process of a recruiting a new chief executive .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News, East

documents.title: child sexual exploitation 'difficult to understand '
text: a senior police officer has told
`` some of the victims themselves do n't recognise that they 're being exploited .
it is difficult for the general public to understand that actually someone can be a victim , but it can appear that they 're consenting , '' bedfordshire police 's det ch insp liz mead said .
last year alone 85 cases of sexual abuse were reported to the police every day , but one officer specialising in child sex abuse said
author: BBC One

text: eight cars have been destroyed by
author: Luton on Sunday

documents.title: hertfordshire summer camp : parents stunned at closure
text: parents of children who 've been going to a summer camp in bushey have been stunned by it 's sudden closure .
`` fortunately for us they were only going for one further day , and then they were going to a different camp , '' said a father of three who 'd attended the camp .
`` had it been the situation that they were due to be there this week and all of next week , we 'd be in a bit of bother . ''
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: the news so far today
text: the top stories we 're looking at this morning :
author: Lee Agnew
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: all change in the hot seat
text: thanks to richard for keeping us up-to-date with the latest news this morning .
i 'll be with you for the rest of the day .
we 'll have more on the hertfordshire summer camp which was closed last week , and will hear about the milton keynes farmer facing eviction .
if you 'd like to get in touch , you can
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: mk dons out to prove doubters wrong
text: mk dons manager karl robinson says being favourites for relegation has spurred his team on .
robinson 's side beat
`` the fact we 're the team that are tipped to go down and finish 24th in the league is tremendous motivation for us , '' he told bbc three counties radio .
author: Richard Haugh
BBC News

documents.title: suspected illegal immigrants found in lorry
text: in case you missed this at the weekend , 18 suspected illegal immigrants were arrested after a lorry was
a motorist called police after following a `` sus lorry on the m25 on saturday .
it was later stopped close to junction 9 of the m1 near st albans and 18 men claiming to be from vietnam were found .
they were arrested on sus of illegal entry to the uk and the driver , a man aged 40 , from poland , was held for assisting entry .
author: Richard Haugh
BBC News

documents.title: travel : problems on m1 and m25
text: one lane is blocked and there is slow traffic on the m1 northbound in bedfordshire , between junction 13 ( a421 bedford ) and junction 14 ( a509 milton keynes ) , because of an accident .
there are also problems on the m25 anti-clockwise , between junctions 17 ( a412 ) and 16 ( m40 ) due to an accident .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: flores pleased with everton draw
text: watford manager quique flores says he was `` really pleased '' with his first match in the premier league - saturday 's
odion ighalo 's strike in the 83rd minute looked like it would give the hornets all three points , but arouna kone grabbed a late equaliser .
flores said : `` i felt it was possible to do something special in my first match in england when we went 2-1 up , but we made some mistakes in the end . ''
author: Richard Haugh
BBC News

documents.title: hs2 committee return to the chilterns
text: mps from the hs2 select committee are making a return visit to buckinghamshire today .
they 'll be examining the route the high speed line will take across the chilterns , and speaking to those who 'll be affected .
author: Lee Agnew
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: luton man in court over 'terror attack '
text: a man from luton is due to appear at the old bailey today , accused of planning a terror attack in the uk .
it 's alleged 24-year-old junead ahmed khan ( right ) , from marlow avenue , was planning to murder a member of the us military .
he 's also accused of intending to join the so-called islamic state in syria , along with his uncle , shazib ahmed khan ( left ) .
author: Richard Haugh
BBC News

text: these are the headlines this morning :
author: Simon Oxley

documents.title: weather : heavy showers by midday
text: most places will start dry this morning .
a band of heavy showers will spread across from the west by midday , clearing to some sunshine later in the afternoon .
with light winds it will feel pleasantly warm later in the day , especially around towcester .
maximum temperature : 21c ( 70f ) .
tonight will stay dry with largely clear skies for many of us .
minimum temperature : 11c ( 52f ) .
kate kinsella
author: BBC Weather

text: welcome to today 's local live page , bringing you all the latest news , sport and weather from across bedfordshire , hertfordshire and buckinghamshire .
